justification: The Simon task was used to assess decision-making and executive control during the experiment. Participants were evaluated on their response accuracy, reaction time, and efficiency throughout the exercise.

The CFF task was utilized to measure overall central nervous system arousal and cortical arousal. The sensory sensitivity criterion (Mtot) and subjective judgment criterion (Mdi) were analyzed to evaluate changes in cognitive performance.
A visual analogue scale was used to assess perceived exertion, reflecting participants' subjective effort levels during the exercise protocol.
The Simon task evaluated response accuracy, consistency, and inhibitory control, which are key aspects of decision-making ability during prolonged HIIE.
